image.altText: Port Augusta courts building

props.synopsis: A South Australian judge says the Department for Child Protection failed to remove a child who was being criminally neglected by her mother despite observing the toddler in "urine-soaked" clothing.

title.children: Mother sentenced after leaving toddler in dirty nappy for days

image.altText: Drone shot of a steelworks factory and piles of coal

props.synopsis: The Whyalla steelworks lost nearly $320 million in the seven months before it was tipped into administration by the South Australian government, with administrators airing concerns about maintenance and safety at the industrial plant.

title.children: 'Relying on luck for safety': Whyalla steelworks losing $1.5m a day before administration

image.altText: A woman's hands hold a human skull.

props.synopsis: SA Police says it had "expertly assessed" several skeletal remains listed for sale by the auction house and the "sale of these anatomically prepared human remains" was not in breach of any state laws.

title.children: Auction house did not break law by selling human bones, police say

image.altText: Multiple red bugs sit on the front of a car headlight.

props.synopsis: Swarms of red bugs have appeared across South Australia in recent weeks as favourable weather conditions and abundant food sources allow the populations to flourish.

title.children: Swarms of mysterious red bugs appear across South Australia

image.altText: A retail worker wearing an Ikea yellow high-vis t-shirt stands near shelves of goods holding a small device

props.synopsis: Retail employers argue staff should have the option to condense a full time week into four days, but some union officials say it's a ploy to have staff work longer hours and avoid overtime pay.

title.children: 'Better balance': Retail workers accept four-day work week, but it's not for everyone

image.altText: On stage, four women in pink netball uniforms stand on a makeshift court. One smiles, hands on hips, as another glares at her.

props.synopsis: Why aren't there more musicals about netball? It's the question you didn't know you wanted answered. Step behind the scenes of an energetic, hot-pink netball musical with a Shakespearean twist.

title.children: What position would Lady Macbeth play in netball, asks new musical

image.altText: legs of a young person in jeans in a dark stairwell.

props.synopsis: The SA opposition says the state is in the grip of a "youth crime crisis", and while the state's police chief has denied the situation is "worse than it has ever been", the government has ruled out raising the age of criminal responsibility.

title.children: Is SA facing a 'youth crime crisis', and how should it manage young offenders?

image.altText: Henry Thornton of South Australia celebrates, raising his arms and extending his index fingers

props.synopsis: South Australia's triumphant cricketers are setting their sights on a historic double, after winning the one-day competition for the first time in 13 years.

title.children: South Australia end 13-year drought with One Day Cup triumph

image.altText: Beaumont children photo

props.synopsis: A seven-day search for the Beaumont children, who went missing from Glenelg Beach in 1966, has concluded after "almost 10,000 tonnes" of soil was dug up as part of the "biggest clandestine grave dig in the world".

title.children: 'We can walk away satisfied': Search for Beaumont children concludes

image.altText: An old man wearing a white cassock with a green band sits with his arms crossed. He has a serious look on his face

props.synopsis: Pope Francis suffers two episodes of "acute respiratory insufficiency" and required  "non-invasive" ventilation, the Vatican says.

title.children: Pope suffers setback with two episodes of 'respiratory insufficiency'

image.altText: An unidentifiable girl with pigtails in a classroom.

props.synopsis: New South Wales has become the latest state to sign an education funding deal with the federal government, meaning most of the country's public schools will now be on track to achieve the minimum funding levels recommended by the Gonski review in 2012.

title.children: Public schools to get billions more in funding after 'massive' deal struck with NSW

image.altText: A man in a black jumper and another man in a blue suit and red tie speak and gesture to each other

props.synopsis: Sweden's former prime minister Carl Bildt has accused Russia of working with the US to undermine Ukraine's position.

title.children: 'Worst moment': Former Swedish PM hits out at Trump over weakening transatlantic alliance

image.altText: Friedrich Merz at an indoors press conference with the CDU political party logo over his shoulder.

props.synopsis: Friedrich Merz, who is likely to be the next German chancellor, has been outspoken in his belief Europe needs to pursue greater independence from the US.

title.children: Incoming German leader says Trump and Zelenskyy clash 'manufactured escalation'

image.altText: US Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents detain a man

props.synopsis: Dawn raids and the threat of being arrested at work spread anxiety among unauthorised migrants in the United States, including more than 1.3 million people from Asia.

title.children: Asians in the US report being 'picked up' due to physical appearance

props.synopsis: Elon Musk is following the "playbook" of Rupert Murdoch in influencing American politics, Silicon Valley insider Kara Swisher tells the ABC's Q+A. And she's worried he could choke Australia's internet access.

title.children: Australia urged to be wary of Musk and reassess relationship with America

image.altText: A group of police talking and walking through the streets of Mannheim, with police vehicles parked in a line.

props.synopsis: Police say a black SUV drove at high speed into a group of people in the German city of Mannheim.

title.children: Two dead, driver arrested after car drives into crowd in German city

image.altText: A woman looks in the mirror while holding her hair back.

props.synopsis: Behind the blood and guts, The Substance carried a viscously important message about how society treats women as they age. Its breakthrough at the Oscars is a landmark moment for women in horror.

title.children: The Oscars hates horror. So how did The Substance get five nominations?

image.altText: Several people in white medical care lean down to place numbers down at the scene of the attack,

props.synopsis: One man has been killed and another four people have been injured in a suspected stabbing attack in Haifa, northern Israel.

title.children: One killed, four injured in suspected stabbing attack in Haifa, Israel

image.altText: An Indigenous AFL player lifts his shirt and points to the colour of his skin in response to racial vilification by the crowd.

props.synopsis: Lawyers say former Indigenous footballer Nicky Winmar could spearhead a class action racism lawsuit against the AFL.

title.children: Former player Nicky Winmar joins class action against AFL, lawyers say

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Jim McDowell speaks with two women. An image of a ship is behind them.

props.synopsis: Jim McDowell, the Deputy Secretary Naval Shipbuilding and Sustainment, will leave his powerful position next month after warning of delays to selecting a winning design for the General Purpose Frigate fleet.

title.children: Senior defence official quits amid tension over $10 billion warship project

image.altText: A bearded man in a turban.

props.synopsis: Rajwinder Singh's blue Alfa Romeo was one of about 70 identified as potentially being linked to the movements of murder victim Toyah Cordingley's phone, a court has heard.

title.children: Jury shown CCTV of alleged murderer's car on day Toyah Cordingley died

image.altText: People filling up sandbags.

props.synopsis: It's the first time many people in south-east Queensland will experience the direct effects of a tropical cyclone, scheduled to make landfall later this week. Here's how you can make sure you're prepared.

title.children: Here's what you can do to prepare for Tropical Cyclone Alfred

image.altText: An older couple sit side by side in a waiting room, in front of a large sign that says "Medicare Urgent Care Clinic".

props.synopsis: The health minister says a historical quirk is behind why two-thirds of existing and promised Medicare urgent care clinics are in Labor-held seats, and they are committed based on need.

title.children: Is Labor pork-barrelling with its urgent care clinics?

image.altText: Mikey Madison wins the Oscar for Best Actress for Anora

props.synopsis: Take a look back at the key moments from the 97th Annual Academy Awards.

title.children: The biggest moments from the 2025 Oscars ceremony

image.altText: A smiling, middle-aged blonde woman in dark evening wear.

props.synopsis: A former NSW juvenile corrections officer jailed for sexually abusing five boys is appealing her conviction and prison sentence on the grounds she was the victim of a miscarriage of justice.

title.children: Corrections officer appeals her conviction for sexually abusing teen inmates

image.altText: A closed beach sign stands on a beach with dark clouds above.

props.synopsis: With Cyclone Alfred set to impact the Sunshine Coast, organisers of the Mooloolaba Triathlon are still confident it will go ahead but are weighing all options.

title.children: Mooloolaba Triathlon at risk as cyclone looms over Sunshine Coast

image.altText: A Soyuz‑2.1b rocket launches.

props.synopsis: Tasmanians have been told debris from a Russian rocket could fall in waters near the island, with the possibility of a "sonic boom" accompanying its re-entry to the Earth's atmosphere over the next few days.

title.children: Russian rocket debris and sonic boom possible off Tasmanian coast

image.altText: A woman in a yellow jacket and sunglasses

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Aboriginal legal service NAAJA has reached a settlement with its former chief executive Priscilla Atkins, ending a bitter legal dispute over her wrongful dismissal dating back to early 2023.

title.children: Aboriginal legal service and former CEO settle long-running legal dispute

image.altText: Vincent Fantauzzo

props.synopsis: How the famous portrait of the Hollywood actor forged an enduring bond between his grieving father and the artist, Vincent Fantauzzo.

title.children: How Kim Ledger became an unlikely father figure to the man who painted his son, Heath's, portrait

image.altText: A woman in a red sweater looks at the camera as she leaves a court building followed by a man and another woman

props.synopsis: Lawyers for a Tasmanian couple convicted of the 2009 shooting murder of their former son-in-law have argued there is a "real possibility" someone else committed the crime — a theory the prosecution says is "fanciful".

title.children: Couple appeal guilty verdict by saying someone else murdered estranged son-in-law

image.altText: Man in trucker hat holds baby while walking

props.synopsis: Lawyers for Matt Wright have issued a subpoena to NT Police for five documents related to the covert surveillance and investigation into the Netflix star, four months out from his Supreme Court trial.

title.children: Matt Wright's lawyers subpoena NT Police documents ahead of trial

image.altText: A man in a headdress and reflective sunglasses raises a fist as he and other dance in a country area.

props.synopsis: A Victorian music festival has been given the green light to go ahead this weekend despite council officers recommending it be shut down.

title.children: Victorian music festival gets green light despite health, safety fears

image.altText: Copy of Copy of Patrick Mellor sentenced for Assault at the Magistrates Court

props.synopsis: A protester was suspended 20 metres in the air, attached to logging machinery, when forestry worker Patrick John Mellor cut one of the ropes. She could be heard screaming, while Mellor walked away sipping his drink.

title.children: Logger sentenced after cutting rope on forest protester's platform

image.altText: A fillet of pink salmon seen on rocks.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's Environment Protection Authority does not know how many farmed salmon have died in recent weeks or what the impact of antibiotic use is.

title.children: 'Self-reporting' salmon industry leaves EPA in dark over mortality figures
